intro: Pentacalia oronocensis, commonly known as the Oronoco pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions. It has a compact growth habit with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of horticultural circles.
